title: Location-based weather app with contextual advice

requirements.text: Create a weather lookup flow that prompts the user for a location via typed input (e.g., city/town name) and allows selecting the intended place when multiple matches exist.

quotes: Make an app where it asks for location and shows that place's temperature and weather

acceptanceCriteria: On first load, the app shows a location input form (no automatic geolocation).
Submitting a location query shows a selectable list of matching places (name + region/country).
Selecting a place sets it as the active location and triggers a weather fetch for that place.
The active location is clearly displayed on the results screen.

requirements.text: Fetch and display the selected location’s current temperature and current weather conditions using a public weather API, with loading and error states.

quotes: shows that place's temperature and weather

acceptanceCriteria: Weather results include at minimum: temperature and a human-readable condition label (e.g., Clear, Rain, Snow, Cloudy).
A loading indicator is shown while the app is fetching geocoding and/or weather data.
If the location cannot be found or the weather API fails, an error message is shown with an option to try again.
Weather fetching is managed via React Query (caching and refetch handling).

requirements.text: Generate and display contextual weather warnings/advice (e.g., “Carry an umbrella”) based on the fetched conditions.

quotes: shows warning like carry an umbrella etc...

acceptanceCriteria: When conditions indicate precipitation (e.g., rain/showers), show advice such as “Carry an umbrella.”
When conditions indicate cold temperatures, show advice such as “Dress warmly.”
When conditions indicate strong wind, show advice such as “Expect gusty winds; secure loose items.”
If conditions are mild/clear, show a neutral positive note (e.g., “Weather looks good.”).
Advice text is in English and updates when the selected location changes.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme across the UI (colors, typography, spacing, and components) suitable for a consumer weather app, avoiding a default/unstyled look.
acceptanceCriteria: The app uses a consistent color palette, typography scale, and component styling across all screens.
The layout looks intentional on mobile and desktop (responsive).
Do not use a blue+purple primary theme unless explicitly requested by the user.

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets to the app and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated.
acceptanceCriteria: The specified generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The app displays the logo in the header and uses the hero/empty-state illustration on the initial/empty state.

constraints: Do not use browser GPS/geolocation APIs; location must be provided by the user via input.
Do not edit files in frontend immutablePaths (compose existing UI components instead).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo); only add migration logic if persistent state changes are required.
nonGoals: User accounts or authentication flows (beyond any template defaults).
Maps, pins, or any geospatial UI.
Real-time weather alerts or push notifications.
Saving favorites/history unless explicitly requested later.

required: Minimal flat illustration of a city skyline with clouds/sun (weather-hero.dim_1200x600.png)
